subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Perceptions!?
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Yeah, must be. I guess they're as taken with that little dog as the rest of 
us. He's uspposed to be my wife's dog, and she was wondering what to name 
him. Winston just popped into my head, and out my my mouth, and it stuck.

Frank


>From: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...>
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Perceptions!?
>Date: Thu, 8 Feb 2007 19:36:56 -0800 (PST)
>
>LOL then maybe this evp was for you I had no idea you named him that.
>
>   This was done on 2-1-2007 and it was in the session with that last batch 
>of evp's i emailed to you privately that were for you.
>
>   Misty
>
>Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:
>           This is a voice I put up a while back, now I hear something 
>different, so I
>have to wonder, which is correct, or is niether correct? This is the stuff
>that makes me say to myself, wait a minute, maybe there's nothing to this
>stuff, it's all percption. I think it's important to question all the
>"truths", all the time. BTW, Winston is our newest Yorkie, weighing in at a
>whopping 2.5 pounds! Not a small dog, a tiny dog! Like a Pixie dog!?
>
>I know there's somethig to the voices, but it's hard to prove something, or
>even demonstrate it if it's highly, highly, highly, highly, highly,
>highly---subjective, and personal?
>
>Oh yeah, another first, I never got my son through the box, I had a voice I
>found last night "Frankie------I'm here", and at least it sounded real.
>
>Frank
